intro: Combretum hereroense subsp. volkensii, commonly known as the Herero combretum, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as savannas and rocky areas. It produces woody capsules that contain small, wind-dispersed seeds. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
